article.headline: North Carolina Greensboro 72, Elon 68
article.story: ELON, N.C. (AP) -- Kyle Hines had 24 points and nine rebounds to lead UNC Greensboro to a 72-68 victory over Elon on Monday night. Ricky Hickman, who added 23 points for the Spartans (7-8, 4-2 Southern Conference), made two free throws with 1.1 seconds remaining to seal the victory. The senior scored 18 points in the second half. The Phoenix (3-11, 1-3 Southern Conference) took a 26-20 lead with 6:13 left in the first half with an 8-2 run. But Elon managed just one field goal the rest of the half and UNC Greensboro took a 31-28 lead. After trading leads early in the second half, UNC Greensboro went on a 17-3 run to open up an 11-point advantage and managed to hold off the Phoenix, who put on a late run. LeVonn Jordan led Elon with 24 points and eight rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
